content: Charter rates continue to accelerate during the quarter, especially in the spot market, our daily TCE for Q3 2022 for our 5 Eco MRs was $29,062 sequentially, up 10.6% over the prior quarter, and up a factor of four versus the results in the same period last year. Over the five year period ending 2021, delays in delivery of new build hours almost 18 MRs per year are known as decision-making process for tanker new ordering a further complicated by ongoing developments in ship and engine designs, stricter environmental regulations, rapidly escalating shipbuilding costs as well as an evolving and still unclear selection and availability of lower carbon fuels. Our time charter equivalent revenues for Q3 of '22, which we define as revenues net minus voyage-related costs and commissions accelerated to $12 million, an increase of $8.5 million from the same period in 2021 due to higher charter rates, especially in the spot market, where we incur voyage related costs and commissions as well as the impact from changes in our fleet. Moving to Slide 13, we generated net income to common shareholders of $5.1 million for the three months ended September 30, 2022 or $0.48 basic and $0.42 diluted EPS compared to a net loss of $3.7 million or $0.37 basic and diluted loss per share in the same period in 2021.
